page.title: 16MEDIA
page.content: Mon.24th June.SCHOOL PATROL SHOCK. Sixth Form pupils may be offered a job as Lollipop Men in an attempt to ease the schools crossing patrol crisis. Nearly one-fifth of the 156 crossing points are unguarded. Tuesday 25th June.PUPILS HIT BY STRIKE .Thousands of pupils stayed at home today as teachers carried out a three- day strike at seventeen schools in Worcester and Malvern. Wednesday 26th June.WIFE KILLER BACK HOME.Worcester man,Christopher Griffiths,was released after being sentenced to jail last December. Thurs 27th June.TOT IN GIRDER HORROR.A small boy,was badly hurt when a car park girder fell on his push chair.Fri.28th June.THANK GOD HE'S SAFE.A whole village was turned out to help Police search for a 6-year old epileptic boy missing from home. Sat,29th June.US Hostages Set Free.
